N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 2 ยง 108.2 - Process for reimbursement

State Regulations

The chief fiscal officer of a municipality seeking
reimbursement under the provisions of subdivision e of section
208-f
of the General Municipal Law shall, on an annual basis by July thirty-first, submit to the Director of Finance in the Office of the State Comptroller both a
certification stating the total amount of special accidental death benefits
paid by the municipality to eligible beneficiaries pursuant to subdivisions b
and c of section
208-f
of the General Municipal Law during the preceding state fiscal year, and a
standard voucher for payment. Each certification shall include: (a) the actual amount of payments made by the
municipality for that purpose, identifying the persons to whom payment was
made, (b) the pension fund or funds
from which payments were made, (c) the total amount of payments made from each fund, and
(d) the total amount sought for
reimbursement. Each standard voucher shall include: (a) the pension fund or funds from which
payments were made, (b) the total
amount of payments made from each fund, and
(c) the total amount sought for
reimbursement. Upon receipt of a complete certification and standard
voucher, payment shall be made upon audit and warrant of the comptroller, subject to the availability of appropriated funds from which payment for this
purpose can be made. Notes
